intro: Ranunculus pantothrix var. capillaceus, commonly known as the slender meadow buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Europe and Asia. It features delicate, yellow flowers with five to seven petals and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It is part of the Ranunculaceae family, known for its showy blooms and often toxic sap. Its slender stems and hairy leaves distinguish it from other ranunculus species.
